data.description:
Wani is your wrist's new best friend!

CutieGator is a stylish watchface for the Pebble, Pebble Time, Pebble Time Round, and Pebble 2. Based off of Mari Okada's "waniwatch" watchface, available here:
https://github.com/mario-kada/waniwatch 

Wani the Alligator will alert you to your battery's state and your Bluetooth connection by vibrating your watch, and can read your daily step count or sleep activity.

Extensive customization options are available for every Pebble.
data.title: CutieGator

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
Watchface with 4 display modes:
1. Cryptic Digital ("sandwich") mode
Each digit is positioned between 2 horizontal lines of squares 

2. Cryptic Analog mode
The outer layer of 12 squares in each figure mimics the conventional analog positions - find the missing square in each figure. Zero is indicated when the middle square is missing thereby forming a zero   

3. Cryptic Time and Date mode
Time at top, date at bottom.  Analog positions for the hour, 5-minutes, single minutes / month, 5-days and single days. Month can be configured to the left or right  

4. Easy mode
Standard digital time  


Colors are configurable (background, time, box background, box top / left border, bottom / right border).

Seconds can be disabled to save battery.


Images:
Animation cycling through the following modes to 12:34:58 on July 9:
(1) Cryptic digital mode
(2) Cryptic analog mode
(3) Cryptic time and date mode
(4) Easy mode
(5) Cryptic digital mode (no seconds)


Designed by Lloyd King and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio. The watchface is published with his permission.

Original design can be found at https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2013/11/06/digitalis-lcd-watch-for-the-cryptographer/
data.title: Digitalis

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
Following a similar vista theme to my "Mountain Backdrop" watchface, this shows a typical seaside view.  Inspired by a recent seaside holiday in Cornwall, UK, it shows seagulls and clouds over boats on the sea.

Time is shown, this time, in 12-11-4 format:
- 12 hours (gulls high in the sky)
- 11 5-minutes (clouds)
- 4 single minutes (boats).


The animation cycles through the following time displays:
(1) 12:59
(2)   7:33
(2)   3:47
(3)   1:01
(4) 11:50
data.title: Sea View

data.description:
Powered by KiezelPay: $0.99 + local taxes after 24-hr trial

Presenting Roman Chrono, an analogue watchface displaying Roman numeral clock digits combined with configurable chronograph features.

NEW: Now with a more authentic Roman chronograph look thanks to NivZ and Northeastpaw!!

Features:-
 - Invert or colour options, bluetooth indicator, display or hide second hand, vibration options, battery percent (red <30%, orange 30% and green 80%)
 - Date displays language in user settings 

Chronograph dials:-
 - Four dials in both analogue and digital format depending on data
 - Dials for seconds, 24hr, 12hr, minute, day, date, month, battery level, steps, heart rate, calories, temperature and weather icon
 - Temp, weather, battery and step dials colour coded where applicable

Weather:
 - Manual or automatic location
 - Current conditions and temperature (C or F)
 - Temp and icon dial from approx -10C/14F to 40C/104F,  coded in blue <12C/22F, green to 25C/45F, orange to 38C/66F and red higher 
 - Master Key (pmkey.xyz) support 

Health where applicable:
 - Steps and Calories (both in K), Heart Rate (BPM)
 - Choose step goal from manual goal or history
 - Steps colour coded in red <75%, orange 75% and green 100% goal 

Enjoy, and send a heart if you do!!

data.description:
Moon and the glimmering reflection on water telling the time.
The 2 partially visible craters on the Moonâ€™s outer edge indicate the hour and the number of 5-minute intervals that have elapsed just like the hands on a normal analogue watch. Single minutes (1-4) are indicated by the 4 craters encircling the middle crater. 
A central crater appears for PM.
Beneath the Moon, the seconds are displayed using horizontal lines to mimic the glimmer of moonlight on ocean waves.  This can be configured to show the day of the month or to disappear (and the moon gets larger) - both of these are battery saving options.


The Moon, reflection (glimmer) and background colors are configurable.


Images:
Animation cycling through the following:
(1) 9:28:52PM
(2) 5:40:39PM
(3) 0:00:00AM (inverted)
(4) 2:31:02AM
(5) 9:28:52PM (no glimmer)

Designed by Lloyd King and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio. The watchface is published with his permission.

Original design can be found at https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/12/03/moonlight-glimmer-lcd-watch/

data.description:
This simple watchface is based on some of the promotional images for the Charcoal/Lime Pebble2, with some extra stuff added, and it works on all rectangular watches.

Down the left side (top down) is,
 - bluetooth icon 
 - quiet time icon
 - battery graphic
 - weather icon
 - temperature (c/f)
 - day/month/date

Across the bottom,
 - heart rate
 - steps

Information can be turned on/off, as can the leading zero for the time, and the info borders.  Time digits can also be centred, and b/w inverted.

data.description:
This is a watchface that I created for my own enjoyment. I publish it here so that others can enjoy it as well.

The point of this watchface is that it is a funny mixture of digital and analog watchfaces, with the added benefit that the hands are equipped with tiny bubbles containing their value.

Many things are configurable:
- Back- and Foreground colors
- Seconds display (enabled by default)
- Vibration on bluetooth disconnect (disabled by default)
- Bubbles (enabled by default)
- Watch hands (enabled by default)

The watchface will display a warning when the phone cannot be reached (bluetooth disconnected). It will also display a battery meter when battery level drops below 40%. The watchface will also display the current heart rate if available. If quiet time is enabled, the watchface will show a tiny "Q" in the lower right corner.

I am open to constructive feedback. Please use github to reach me.

latest_release.release_notes: Added an indication for quiet time (only available on firmware 4.3).

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
A digital watchface with two display modes:
- Mask: Tops and bottoms of numbers are hidden
- LEET: numbers converted into text letters & shapes
Should really call this reverse LEET as LEET is letters converted into numbers.
For each digit, LEET cycles through 3 different letters / shapes. 

Time will display in 12-hour or 24-hour mode, depending on the watch setting.

Configuration options:
- There is a choice of 6 backgrounds to display behind the time section
- Time color
- Color of bar between time and backgound
- Switch between Mask or LEET displays
- Leading zero on hours can be hidden


Images:
Animation cycle running through: 
 12:59 (Mask)
 12:59 (LEET)
 07:38 (Mask)
 07:38 (LEET)
   6:54 (Mask)
   6:54 (LEET)
An image showing the Mask numbers
An image showing the LEET number variations


This design was created by Anders Svedell and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio. It is published with the designersâ€™ permission. 

The original design can be found here: https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2012/03/30/mask-lcd-leet-watches-for-the-discerning-hacker/

data.author: Nev Rawlins
data.description:
An analog style watchface with the hours in the typical analog positions in the outer segments within the square.  
The 10-minute segments count from the the inside to the current hour position (i.e. the 50 Min marker would be adjacent to the hour marker).
The single minutes are the 9 squares in the center.

In addition, the date can be displayed about the square and below are the Bluetooth connection, battery level and Quiet time indicator (speaker shown if quiet time disabled).

Configuration options:
- all colors are configurable
- The extra info (date, BT, battery & quiet zone) can be hidden


Images:
Animation cycle running through: 
  3:42, 
  5:28, 
  6:54, 
  9:37 (Quiet and no BT), 
12:11 (no extras) 


This design was created by Justin Schofield and originally appeared on the Tokyoflash Design Studio. It is published with the designersâ€™ permission. 

The original design can be found here: https://blog.tokyoflash.com/2014/06/04/depth-watch-creates-3d-tunnel-effect-with-el-paper/

data.description:
A customizable watchface inspired by the Casio W800H and W96H digital watches.

Now with customizable colours!

The layout consists of five customizable slots, which can also optionally show different info on a shake/tap.

Also includes multiple vibration styles for hourly and BT connect/disconnect events with strength settings, selectable 'branding' images to customise the look and two background styles - the W800, and W96H.

An optional 'Weather Box' can also replace the top and/or bottom branding to show daily low, high and current temperatures, sunrise/sunset times, current weather or forecast weather, or many combinations of these.
The toggles in top right shows the battery level, Bluetooth connection and quiet time status.



Weather support from OpenWeatherMap and WeatherUnderground, although forecast options are limited on OWM.

Available data includes:
General Info: Battery level with or without %.
Time Info: Day and Month word, Day, Week and Month and Year numbers, and the Date numbers (in 6 different styles).
Health Info: Steps and Heartrate
Weather Info: Current Temperature, Sunrise time, Sunset time, Current weather conditions, Forecast weather conditions.
Heartrate has a small arrow indicating whether the current value is higher or lower than the previous one.

Now with Pebble Master Key (pmkey.xyz) support!

---
Developed and properly tested only on a Pebble 2 HR.

latest_release.release_notes:
[0.10]
Fixed a fatal crash/reboot problem with v4 firmwares, implemented workaround.
  (Invoking 'text_layer_get_content_size()' can randomly crash the watch, so it can't be used to resize the weather information boxes. Some longer information that should spill to two lines might not do that, there's not much I can do about it)

data.description:
Imagine a universe with new constellations and develop new stories to describe them.

On Your Wrist is the Universe: Constellation Poems is a watchface that generates constellations within random starfields. The watchface generates new names for these constellations, as well as presenting the wearer with a series of words that can provide the basis for new stories about this generated universe.

On Your Wrist is the Universe is a series of generative poems that draw inspiration from the materials of the universe.

On Your Wrist is the Universe is a series of generative poems that draw inspiration from the materials of the universe.

data.author: chops
data.description:
PTR only.

Just the simple representation of health metrics via arcs/circles.

Most of it is configurable,
 - second hand on/off
 - minute and hour hand colour
 - second hand colour

Each of the metric arcs/rings can be coloured individually,
 - steps (outer) (shoe icon)
 - restful calories (knife & fork icon)
 - active time (running person)
 - distance (inner) (tape measure icon)

The inner-most (multi-colour) ring is the battery level (with a tiny icon). 
 - green (full),
 - dark red (empty).

The very middle blue dot also represents bluetooth status
 - on/showing = connected
 - off/hidden = disconnected

The background can be black (empty), dark grey rings, or your own colour combination.
data.title: Health Metrix

Kill it... if you have to.

Also, happy Star Wars day!

Rebellions are built on hope!

What about the droid attack on the Wookiees?

Fixed: Crashing when an error occurred while fetching the weather.

I've got a bad feeling about this...

Fixed: Crashing when weather happens.
Fixed: Fahrenheit not displaying properly. #Metric4lyfe

It's a trap!

Fixed: Weird things happening with the weather icon when an error occurs while getting the weather and the targeting computer is being animated.

I Find Your Lack of Weather Disturbing

New: Weather - conditions and temperature!
New: Settings - Vibrate on Bluetooth disconnect, hourly vibration, animation, health, weather.
New: Masterkey pmkey.xyz integration.

Fixed: Better memory management for animation.

Stay On Target!

That's No Moon!

Changed: Background on square watches no longer has a rectangle for a notification dot.
Fixed: Step count now updates before the watchface launches.

First release!

The Force is strong with this one.

data.author: chops
data.description:
A simple clear watchface.  Daily steps circle around the outside. A red line will show until the daily average is reached, then it turns blue.  Your step goal can be set in the configuration - the average (indicated by a small red marker) is automatically calculated. For the PT the step goal is top right below the tiny walker image (in 1k increments) and daily steps are above - both of these match up with the outer ring. The lowest goal value that can be displayed is 500 (and a max of 20k)

Configuration also has,

 - choice of different font styles
 - battery status on/off
 - HR on/off - for the P2 if you want it off permanently adjust via your app health settings
 - BT and hourly vibrations

 - supports 12/24hr modes
 - icon to show quiet time status (to the left of the BT icon)

data.description:
A watchface designed for outdoor activities like trailrunning or hiking, providing the following useful info:

* current time and date
* position (GPS with caching)
* sunset and sunrise time
* 3h 6h 9h 12h weather forecast icons
* 3h 6h 9h 12h temperature forecast (in C/F)
* last hour steps count coloured histogram (1 bar/minute, red means +100 steps/minute)
* day step count
* battery level
* bt connection

Feel free to comment/suggest new features!

NOTE: obtain your free OpenWeatherMap appid at: http://openweathermap.org/appid

data.description:
This is a variation of the basic text watchface.

This is NOT a game - just a watchface.  Although it has raised other ideas about joining words, but alas all variations of time as words don't have a common letter.. though there are blank tiles in the actual game..

There a a few background variations - coloured boards, or just plain.. it can also be inverted.

Below the time it shows battery, BT, Quiet time, date.
data.title: Screbble

data.author: chops
data.description:
A recreation of the popular, often used pixel/GRID style.

Based on the original grid code by Lukasz Z, with clay (yahoo) weather by orviwan (chunk).

Compatible with all watch shapes, supports 12/24 hour.

On a P2 HR displays on the bottom row if active.

Row 2 can also display the battery status or week number.

Row 3 can also display the weather (c or f).

For the Time series, the 1st and/or 4th row can be any colour.

On all watch types, the screen can be inverted.
data.title: Grid HR+

data.author: aliner

changelog.release_notes:
Major updates that graduate the watch to version 1.
- Added date display and "midnight line"
- Added time in current location.
- Improved settings.
- Added connection indication by highlighting darkening map overlay.
- Fixed summer time bug.
- Many small bug fixes.

This is the initial beta release. The main functionality works but automatic location is so-so. 
It is recommended to turn it off in the settings to conserve power.
If you want new features contact me on e-mail or github.

data.description:
This watchface is perfect while travelling.
It allows to keep any 2 time-zones visible while showing their position on the world map and the offset from current location.
Yes, the time in the current location is also here!
Map display features optional passing and coming dates with current position of "midnight line".
The current date is highlighted and grayed out when in the airplane mode.

Configuration is done using google map search.
The map displays features the night and day overlay borrowed from https://github.com/davidfg4/pebble-day-night
Optimized for 4.0
Known issues:
- To account for time saving the watch needs to be restarted.
- If you have suggestions how to visualise current time-zone, please let me know (email or github)
